website_summaries.verdict: An affordable cover that works best indoors.
pros: This waterproof polyester cover fits most snowmobiles
For its price range, this is a great value
cons: Cover may develop rips over time if used with a trailer

customer_reviews.title: Never let’s water or snow in.
customer_reviews.text: On 12/04/2015 I purchased one cover for a used Skidoo. The cover has worked perfectly and to date shows no fading or wear. The snowmobiles are kept outside all winter and stored inside all summer with the covers on. The cover for my cat was $475.00 and is a much better cover and you can trailer with this cover! I never consider the Budge cover for trailering for a cost of forty something! I will be ordering another Budge cover for my cat this year because you just give it a shake in the winter and all the snow just slides off I have to sweep the snow off the cat cover.
customer_reviews.author: DaddyDog

customer_reviews.title: wont last
customer_reviews.text: This snowmobile cover is super light weight, non-breathable. It did fit my Phazer II LT from the skis to the track, so that is good, but any humidity collects inside the cover. I dont expect it to stand up to the elements at all. Instead for a few more dollars pick up the North East Harbor SM3B138 it fits similarly with a bit of extra room, and comes with tie down hooks. That cover is easily a $100 cover for only 50.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nearest location of Harbor Freight store!
customer_reviews.text: Despite giving the measurements which my sled fell in those parameters...it does not fit what so ever! It doesn’t look anything like the pictured sled in your ad! The elastic is way, way too tight/short! When stretched out it just covers the bottom part of the seat, and it’s so tight pulling it over the rear bumper that it popped the mounting points on the windshield! Better off buying an oversized tarp at Harbor Freight!
customer_reviews.author: Harley Narley

customer_reviews.title: The quality of material is a bit thinner than I’d like, but for the price it’s great
customer_reviews.text: This fits our 2005 Polaris two up perfectly. It isn’t too snug or too loose. The quality of material is a bit thinner than I’d like, but for the price it’s great. It’s holding up great at our cabin where we get tons of snow and it stays nice and dry and covered.
customer_reviews.author: Fallensavior

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not trailer worthy
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't dare trailer with this, but to keep water/snow off the sled, might work for a season, maybe two. Probably will fall apart with a lot of sun on it. Going to put it over my regular cover when it's parked in the garage. This fit a Yamaha rx-1 mountain tip to tail.
customer_reviews.author: EureskoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: It’s shaped super weird and the 1st time I went to use it the strap that goes under the sled broke off. Super cheap. I mean it will work for this summer I guess, but I’ll have to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: When I received this I thought it was not going to last. I was wrong. This is the second full season and I'm very impressed. I will buy another one. It sat in brutal winds and direct sunlight every day... it faded but the nylon was not compromised. It's tough. It gets the most extreme exposure to all elements here ..and fits over the largest ski do cargo box available. Super amazon score for me
customer_reviews.author: Cory M.

customer_reviews.title: I purchased 2 covers went on a trip all straped ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 covers went on a trip all straped down cover still ripped up.is there any way i can get this warantied out for 2 new covers or a refund thankyou peter 5857504527
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Snowmobile cover.
customer_reviews.text: The cover works well but it does not cover my Artic Cat Bearcat completely. It does cover the engine and seat area. After a couple of months of use, it is starting to wear in some areas so you can see through it. It definitely cannot be used as a travel cover. For the price, I expct to get a couple of years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.....
customer_reviews.text: This is a good cover for the sled sitting in the back yard to keep it clean and out of the sun. It's not made for hauling sled. Good quality and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: David M Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Little smaller than advertised
customer_reviews.text: My 1999 Arctic Cat ZL 500 is 108" from nose to rear bumper so I bought the 115" cover but the elastic is so tight I can barely pull it over. Get the bigger cover just to be safe otherwise it seems like a good cover
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Good cover
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price. Worth the money and protects the sled. Definitely measure your sled for proper size. I bought the small cover for what I thought was a small sled and it’s a snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: JTPerry

customer_reviews.title: The cover is pretty decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Size Large fit my 1995 Ski Doo Mach 1 barely. Its tight but fits well. The cover is pretty decent for the money. Its no more than a dust cover though. I personally wouldn't use it outside in the rain and snow. I keep mine under a awning so this should do.
customer_reviews.author: Jay G.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal!
customer_reviews.text: Good deal for the price. Holds up pretty well but don't think it will hold up under lots of punishment. I have three of these and I am happy with them!
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This covers my seat and cowling. It is water repellent and tight, so I have kept it. But it is smaller than advertised. It's about 10-12 inches shorter than they say.
customer_reviews.author: Dadicus

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one summer, got very brittle and had come ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one summer, got very brittle and had come appart in several places before winter, $30 for a few months of heat?? Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Jason Weimer

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Good product covers well has a strap to go under the sled so it won’t blow off on a windy day, happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Daut

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than advertised/ odd shape
customer_reviews.text: Cover is much smaller than advertised so won’t fit over my sled. Waste of money. The cover is also a strange shape, so assuming even IF the advertised length was correct, it still wouldn’t cover the entire snowmobile as it shows in the pic.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M

customer_reviews.title: Strap Broke
customer_reviews.text: The strap that secures it under the sled broke in the first 2 minutes of putting it on the sled (strap tore off of cover). I didn't try to return as they seemed overall decent for the price and the elastic portion seemed to hold/grip the sled well enough without the strap. Would not take them down the road with this cover though.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Norton

customer_reviews.title: A great deal on a quality cover
customer_reviews.text: Good fit for my Artic Cat F570 2008 touring sled with backrest. Goes over the sled easy with a strong elastic cord sewn into the entire lower edge. Coated fabric that looks to last a few years. Stuff sack included. Lower locking buckle strap as well. Looks good.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: good size to fit many machines
customer_reviews.text: i bought four of these to cover my sleds. they fit small ones 121 track all the way up to my 151 track!! it has rained and they are waterproof. not sure on how long they will last in the sun but for the price i can replace often.
customer_reviews.author: michael cortese

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: Nice cover. Fits well on my 95 Yamaha vmax dx trail/touring model. 4 stars because tie down strap was not attached well and tore off right away. You don't need the strap unless transporting.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Buy XL no matter what
customer_reviews.text: I have a 96 Arctic Cat 440z (zr chassis). My gut told me XL and it was right. Only have a medium winshield but it does have mirrors. Good for storing outside but I doubt it would hold up to interstate travel on an open trailer. Keeps the elements off for cheap
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: fits
customer_reviews.text: fits my long track that only sits outside. I wouldn't expect it to hold up being trailered as it is not that durable. works for me
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight cover for keeping snow and water off.
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2000 Pantera two-up touring sled. This is a very long machine. XL cover fit just perfect. Super light nylon, not very rugged. A great cover to put on after your ride to keep the sled dry and snow free.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Fouts

customer_reviews.title: Do not fit
customer_reviews.text: Ok...my sleds are 115 inch 2 ups. I ordered covers to fit up 2 138inches...as you can see they do not fit. The material is poor quality and I question these reviews. Does the manufacturer buy its own product and write reviews??
customer_reviews.author: James Ogilvie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap storge alternative to a heavy duty factory cover.
customer_reviews.text: A reasonabley priced light weight cover suitable for occasional outside use. Thats what i paid for..and thats what i received.
customer_reviews.author: S.W.

customer_reviews.title: Fit over 1996 XLT /SKS with rack
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a shower cap looks well made Time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Wade A. Howe

customer_reviews.title: It's OK as a dust cover.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my new Ski Doo........didn't fit very well. As per its measurements it should have fit. Works fine to keep the dust/snow off.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Bain

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit my ski doo grand touring but made well
customer_reviews.author: Todd Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat this
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised . Will be buying 2 more in the future
customer_reviews.author: Loren

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit very good I have a 145 inch snowmobile and it only fit over the seat and the front of the sled but I never got to use it since the buckles broke as I was applying it
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Great snowmobile cover
customer_reviews.text: Excellent snow mobile cover. Fits my sled perfectly and is durable.
customer_reviews.author: M. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Nice little cover
customer_reviews.text: Nice little cover but may be a little too light. We will see how it performs.
customer_reviews.author: WAD442

customer_reviews.title: color and price
customer_reviews.text: Our snowmobile cover ,came in as described and fit to a "T" very happy
customer_reviews.author: Doris T.

customer_reviews.title: Fits great
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my sleds. Both newer style skidoo’s. While they don’t fit 100% perfectly they fit well enough to keep the snow off the sled.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money. Needs straps to hold it down
customer_reviews.author: theresa brissette

customer_reviews.title: this works great and fits as it should
customer_reviews.text: I picked up a used (older) sled but didnt have room in the garage during the winter months. I also didnt want to leave it exposed. For the cost, this works great and fits as it should.
customer_reviews.author: rdub

customer_reviews.title: Fit my 1997 Arctic Cat 440 ZL
customer_reviews.text: Seems to run small. I got a Large and it fits pretty well. I leave my sled inside with the cover on but I don't know how well it would hold up outside all the time. It seems a little flimsy but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cost, cheap material.
customer_reviews.text: The product said it large. It is quite small and barely fit my snowmobile.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Davee

customer_reviews.title: Nice durable cover for cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cover for the money. It's the most durable I've seen in this price range. I do store my sleds outdoors in the winter and think I should definitely be able to get a few years or more out of this cover.
customer_reviews.author: Mark555055

customer_reviews.title: Can carry it with on trips
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 1996 Yamaha 600 . It does fit and is a good price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit our large 2up
customer_reviews.text: Fits well, seems to be good quality, for the price even if it needs replaced every few years I say it’s worth it
customer_reviews.author: Laura S

customer_reviews.title: Protect snowmobile
customer_reviews.text: Great cover for snowmobile that is parked at home outside.Handels all types of weather conditions including freezing rain.Stays put with the elastic bands that hug the under side of snowmobile.Good value!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit the size sled it says it does. It was too small and it was very thin and cheap quality
customer_reviews.author: CHARITY O.

customer_reviews.title: Get the next size bigger
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t really fit as the measurement would lead to believe. My smaller sled is 115 inches nose to rear of the seat and this barley fits. It’s barley able to snap the buckle underneath also.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: And waterproof works great. Sadly we are getting more rain than snow
customer_reviews.text: Plenty long enough but 6 inches short on the side. Doesn't cover the foot rails. And waterproof works great. Sadly we are getting more rain than snow.
customer_reviews.author: Onemanwo1fpackz

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 95 ski doo formula Sl perfectly. Seems to hold up to weather and travel very well. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robin S

customer_reviews.title: I bough two of these for two identical machines. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bough two of these for two identical machines. One fits really tight. The other is 5" short. Neither is as big as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: scott stroede

customer_reviews.title: Discribed cover size is not correct.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how you get your measurements but this 145" long cover doesn't fit on a 131" long sled..
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: The cover ripped after only 1 use. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Julie L.

customer_reviews.title: fits fine.
customer_reviews.text: Cant beat the price. have it on 2011 800 ETech with mirrors. fits fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Halling

customer_reviews.title: Hard pressed to find a better cover for less money
customer_reviews.text: Came as described. Decent fit, decent material. Hard pressed to find a better cover for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Guentner

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for price.
customer_reviews.text: Great for a quick cover so we don’t have to load in trailer between rides.
customer_reviews.author: tami

customer_reviews.title: Other wise the cover seemed nice. I would not really call it travel cover
customer_reviews.text: Does not Fit a 2015 Ski-Doo GSX SE 800 E-TEC, or a 2014 Ski-Doo GSX SE 600 HO. Length fits, width does not. To short on the sides. Other wise the cover seemed nice. I would not really call it travel cover, but would be a great storage cover
customer_reviews.author: Sheptack

customer_reviews.title: A great sled cover that goes on easy and protects well
customer_reviews.text: A great sled cover that goes on easy and protects well. I wouldn't trust it going down the highway though
customer_reviews.author: Danny knapp

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Not durable at all. Had one new on my sled over the summer, then it came apart at the seams on the trailer going down the highway
customer_reviews.author: cewsuk

customer_reviews.title: Value and perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: This fit great on my sled and is really nice quality
customer_reviews.author: Ben Timmerman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like it for the price, probably wouldn't last too long sitting outside though
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy built
customer_reviews.text: Good night or day cover easy to fold up to travel with
customer_reviews.author: michael w sanderson

customer_reviews.title: Not Trailerable
customer_reviews.text: Fitment was okay. Strap ripped immediately. Do not use this on an open trailer , mine ripped immediately .
customer_reviews.author: randy

customer_reviews.title: Great Cover
customer_reviews.text: Fair price and it fits my early 90's 2 person sled very well. Holds up to high winds and stays very secure.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It is not a 115 inches
customer_reviews.text: This cover is not a 115 inches. I had to squezz it on my son's 105 inch snowmachine.
customer_reviews.author: Ben is bent

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: The wind ripped it. It's very thin and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Gretta Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great cover for the price. |SKi-doo 380 Formula-large fit great
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Vander Meer

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my husband. It fits perfectly on his snowmobile.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Winters

customer_reviews.title: Cover didn't fit after using measurements provided
customer_reviews.text: Cover was way to small measuring sled from the points indicated.
customer_reviews.author: Unhappy

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit Bearcat XT 570. Will will cover front to back seat, but not back rack, despite advertising it will cover 145 in.
customer_reviews.text: Flexible, easy to take off and on in freezing icy snowy weather. Does not cover sled fully.
customer_reviews.author: Carroll Hills, Maine

customer_reviews.title: Ripped while traveling on open trailer
customer_reviews.text: Ripped after one use, maybe it wasn't meant for travel?
customer_reviews.author: Noah Gedrimas

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The clip to hold it on ripped off the cover as soon as I tried to clip it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but the straps that are sewn into it are weak at best, i put the cover on my snowmobile and ...
customer_reviews.text: the cover is ok, but the straps that are sewn into it are weak at best, i put the cover on my snowmobile and when i went to hook up the strap the threading broke and came off with out any effort. I dont think id get it again
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Gray

customer_reviews.title: Wont buy another one.
customer_reviews.text: It showed up with a 3 foot rip in it!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter clark

customer_reviews.title: My snowmobile is well under the measurements that this cover ...
customer_reviews.text: My snowmobile is well under the measurements that this cover claims to fit. The cover is not even close to fitting my sled!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Homan

customer_reviews.title: arrived as expected and fit all the machines correctly with ...
customer_reviews.text: arrived as expected and fit all the machines correctly with the exception of one which had a aftermarket extension on the back for a fuel can.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Covers the Top of My Sled
customer_reviews.text: This is a fair bit smaller than advertised. I have a Cat Pantera Touring, a 2up w/ luggage rack, high windshield. Based on the reviews, I wasn't expecting full coverage for the entire machine, but did expect the cover to be deep/ tall enough to envelope the hood to the rear seat - down to the floorboards. Nope. This isn't a big problem for me. I can kick the snow off easily enough and still have hood, seat, bars and instruments protected. Good enough, but not what I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.author: John Ashton

customer_reviews.title: not happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: not happy with this product , the first time it got wet and the wind blew it ripped the buckle off, the water proofing all peeled off and the end that came undone from the sled shredded in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Thing is junk. Had the cover on the sled in back of truck with my additional tie down straps. Not even an hour on the highway and this cover TORE apart in several different areas. Complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It fit very nicely, was easy to deploy and sheds snow and water perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: E. Buccolingua

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The strap stitching ripped the very first time putting it on. What a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my snowmobile for the summer lasted not even one week total garbage will never buy another one of these
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's thin material. We are going to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: It's thin material. We are going to use it for our lawn tractor. It really doesn't fit our 2012 Arctic Cat snow-machine.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This item was terrible. It was ripped to pieces when I trailered it on my snowmobile. The wind just shredded it to pieces. I will never buy that again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SERIOUS SLEDDERS, DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! Nothing more than a garbage bag with an elastic at the bottom. Cheap plastic with no cloth portion to go over cowling and windshield. Blew away in first storm. Good riddance!!
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Good price, nice cover
customer_reviews.text: Really nice cover for my Sled. Love it fits like a glove..
customer_reviews.author: lou kozaczek

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy for the price and the sizing chart was way off.
customer_reviews.author: Roderik N.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Shredded during first use. You get what you pay for in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good cover for indoors storage.
customer_reviews.text: Elastic on the bottom and a strap to keep it down. This would be a great dust cover in the garage or shed but I plan on leaving it outside and do not think it will last long with UV exposure. Came in a nice little bag.
customer_reviews.author: Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Light duty but perfect for keeping water and dirt off machine. I wish I would have gotten the largest size, it would have given me more room for the width of my Skandic, but it still fits ok.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Harren

customer_reviews.title: Met Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Found I did not need and returned with no problem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: More like dust cover but serves its purpose. didn't expect anything more the money
customer_reviews.author: Steve uhrovcik

customer_reviews.title: Buy something better
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Cheap price for a poorly constructed cover. Flimsy material, and the buckle broke right off when covering my snowmobile for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Rohm

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material.  Will not last.  NOT worth your money
customer_reviews.text: This cover did not stand up to one winters worth of use. It is already torn, severely faded and basically worthless. Will have to find a new cover for my sled.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Tanner OConnell

product_meta.title: Budge Sportsman Snowmobile Cover, Waterproof, Fits up to 145"
product_meta.description: Size:XLarge: Fits snowmobiles 145" L x 51" W x 48" HThe Budge waterproof snowmobile cover provides superior protection against rain, sun, snow, dust and dirt. This cover is made from a high-quality polyester that is 100% waterproof. This material is non abrasive to your snowmobile's finish and fully breathable to prevent mold or mildew from growing under the cover. Cover features a full elastic hem for a tight, secure fit. A storage bag is included so you can easily store your cover when not in use.
feature_bullets: SIZED TO FIT: This snowmobile cover fits snowmobiles 145" L x 51" W x 48" H
HEAVY DUTY: This snowmobile cover is made from a heavy duty material that will provide long lasting protection to your snowmobile
WATERPROOF: This snowmobile cover is 100% waterproof and will defend against rain, sun, snow, dirt and more
SECURE YOUR COVER: This cover features an elasticized hem to help keep your cover secure to your snowmobile
STORAGE BAG: A storage bag is included so you can easily store away your snowmobile cover when it is not in use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars443 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
